summary: Adds a small player home designed for Stealth characters.
descriptionHtml:
This mod adds a new player "home" to the area right outside of Whiterun near Fort Greymoor. There isn't a lot there but it is suited for someone who would like to avoid the bright lights of the city.

Perks of this little place
-Mannequin pre-equipped with some gear aimed toward a stealth character.
-Weapon racks with Elven swords preattached
-A bed that grants the "well rested" perk
-Safe storage (chest, satchel, knapsack, dresser)
-Alchemy table
-Small shelf that works as a bookshelf
-Statue of Nocturnal that adds a stealth perk and removes any diseases you may have caught.

F.A.Q.
Q: How do I get into the Safehouse?
A: Once you get to the destroyed house, there is a key sitting on the fireplace mantle. Picking it up will complete the quest and allow you to open to trapdoor near the fireplace.

Q: Why make such a simple house mod when there are so many better ones available?
A: I wanted something small and kind of "out of sight" for my Stealth based characters. Plus I wanted to figure out this "writing a script" thing, so I did.

Q: Are you going to be adding features?
A: Maybe. I'm toying around with the idea of adding more loot to certain places, making them worth robbing. High profile places will have more things of value to steal. I also may add a new fence merchant to sell your haul to, without having to be in the Thieve's guild.

Q: Is the stuff that's already included guaranteed to be there in future release?
A: No and some items may be tweaked as well.
author: tat2teel

files.name: Thief Safe House Brighter Light
files.changelogHtml:
Replaced Light sources with non-shadow casting ones to remove shadow striping
Added random Whiterun Guard armor to dresser with note on table (RP items don't hate)
